relation: It is a private college so the tuition is VERY EXPENSIVE.
The food is okay for cafeteria food but there are very few choices and it gets old very fast.
Biology and math classes are tough but the English is the easiest.
Have a car if you decide to come here. Stay away from the quad dorms and stay in Riggs or Post. Make sure to add a lot of dining dollars cause the main cafe is small and gets old VERY FAST.

This college has great academics besides English but sadly no campus life. Relaxing and peaceful campus with not many food or places to hangout. Nothing within walking distance which means taking a bus if you don't have a car

TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {137130=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 40387=LIU Post is an exquisite school equipped with a full recreational center, gourmet food, and a club for everybody. Like all schools the work is diifficult but there are upperclass tutors and teachers available to assist in any problems you may have. I cannot wait to begin in September., 32911=One good thing is that there is this mandatory break time; it's from 12:30-1:50. It's called Common Hour and during this time there are no classes so you get to hang out with friends, meet with professors if you have questions regarding your paper, join clubs, study notes for next class, etc.}

textAfterTable: Categories Comments Am enjoying being here I think what makes post enjoyable is if you are studying something that you like. I am a dance major at the school and I love the experience that I am getting. Along with all the great people I meet, I am able to further my knowledge in something I love doing. The campus is also an ideal size for me as well as the location. If you're looking for a smaller campus with a homey feel then post is for you.
